channel.title: Mac os-x help pleease! 0.0
channel.description:
my windows is set up for hosting servers but i cant use the windows for hosting any more sooooo.. i want a tutorial for making a .bat into a terminal command or somthing like that. (ooooorr) a server that is already set up for macs
(note: please dont hate on macs -.- and if you dont know were to find a tut or you dont know how to do this gtfo of here..)
i am currently runnning: mac osx leopard (soon to be snow leopard)
oo and if you can please post a silab client that works with macs too?

item.title: Mac os-x help pleease! 0.0
item.dc:creator: @h4x0r88 h4x0r88
item.description:
@h4x0r88 wrote:

thx for the try but the silab client on the website is windows only (atleast as far as i can see on all my macs the website gos to 100% then restarts on loading cache)i figured out how to run and compile my server now all i need is a client that i can run on macs easy with out entering like 400 lines of commands

Read full topic

item.title: Mac os-x help pleease! 0.0
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Macs you shell scripts just like Linux. Moparscape V3.2 comes with pre-made shell script:

It looks like this:

#!/bin/sh java -noverify -Xmx500m -cp .:./MoparScape.jar: Bot 0 #param 0 for highmem, 1 for lowmem

Normal clients will look similar but after the command “java” there will be the main class which is normally either “EGUI” or “Client”

Silab Webclient should work… http://client.silabsoft.org/client.php

Read full topic
